INNERLINK
1110 HOWARD ST,
SAGINAW, MI, 48601-2734
Re: License #: CI730201193
Dear Mr. Gloss:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving the license
in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If you move,
please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Tyler Armstrong, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
(989) 264-9217
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility is advised to ensure all updated forms, such as service plans, are in
use after they are implemented.
• The facility is advised have a timely response to necessary inspection tasks such
as application submission, Chief Administrator report and the scheduling of
necessary inspections.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was not offered any consultation during this inspection.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
previous year’s interim insepction results in an approved Corrective Action Plan
dated 04/20/2023. This plan contained two sets of planning for incident reporting
and discharge planning, and both cited rules were not found to be repeat violations
during this renewal inspection. Special Investigation # 2024C000876SI was
approved on 11/08/2023 and the resulting CAP was approved on 12/14/2023. The
CAP contained action planning regarding the communication with DCWL of Plan
Review requests and construction plans. There have been no concerns regarding
the follow through of action items from this CAP. The facility has maintained good
communication with DCWL on the current kitchen renovation project since that
time.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and financial overviews were provided, and no concerns were
noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator report was provided and reviewed. Dated 05/09/2024 it
stated there were no significant barriers that prevented any rule compliance.
During this past reporting period there was one unplanned discharge that did not
present concern for any trends within the program. The report did not review the
current Corrective Action Plan regarding Plan Review submission, but it has been
assessed that the facility is in compliance with this plan and following their action
steps has resulted in good communication with DCWL regarding construction
projects.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were completed during the on-site inspection and no concerns
were noted.

There were no current youth placed in the program during the time of the
inspection.
Description of Agency Walk Through
No safety concerns exist within the use of the building. Construction of the kitchen
and recreation area has been paused while a variance is sought for rule 400.4559
(1). There are no safety concerns, and the needs of the youth are being met
through the use of the smaller kitchen located on the other side of the building.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
05/13/2024
